TopicTitle: [1.2.x] Aviator Arsenal - World War 2 aircraft weaponry (v1.3)

Articles.Content:
You could tell by my username, couldn't you? Still, Yes! Now, what should I get up to with that 75mm gun? Hmmm......

I really, really want to see what is going to be made with that beast.

@TUKE: The current version is 1.0.4.

Twice as long? That sounds a bit too much.

I really, really want to see what is going to be made with that beast.

@TUKE: The current version is 1.0.4.

Twice as long? That sounds a bit too much.

Wait so the mod is 1.0.4? I though that was the game version it worked on:P

Remembering that mine is muzzle - Barrel - Receiver block - Funny cylinder bit on the end. I have quite a bit more gun modeled.

I really, really want to see what is going to be made with that beast.

Some sort of bomber-killing heavy fighter? And yes, i KNOW that the Bordkanone 7.5 "is" meant for ground attack, BUT it is going to be used to kill bombers, which I am AWFUL at designing.

Some sort of bomber-killing heavy fighter? And yes, i KNOW that the Bordkanone 7.5 "is" meant for ground attack, BUT it is going to be used to kill bombers, which I am AWFUL at designing.

Wouldn't 50mm be more suitable for that? I mean it would still be rubbish compared to 24xR4M or 4x30mm (and two jet engines), but at least it was meant to do that more than 75mm.

Ill just take the much needed variety in bombs thank you

Great mod:cool:

@UnknownOrbit: Great!

@everybody: we have a little surprise for the next update.

Actually, more than one.

We are not rushing it so this may take a bit of time, and it's going to be amazing.

You can find my replicas here for now: http://kerbalx.com/hangars/678

There are still some missing, which I will add as I have time, then I will make a post about it and update the mod's album to use them.

They were meant to get very close to their real life characteristics, with as low part count as it was possible.

Hope you enjoy.

*Oh, and they use AJE, which was not recognized for some reason, you can go without but the engines size change so do it at your own risk.

**Yes the Ki-43 is OP, hehe.
